entries.name: genspace
entries.desc: A lambda or Proc, that takes one argument, of a Fixnum, and returns the corresponding number of spaces. By default this is: lambda {|n| ' ' * n}

entries.name: group_queue
entries.desc: The PrettyPrint::GroupQueue of groups in stack to be pretty printed

entries.name: indent
entries.desc: The number of spaces to be indented

entries.name: maxwidth
entries.desc: The maximum width of a line, before it is separated in to a newline This defaults to 79, and should be a Fixnum

entries.name: newline
entries.desc: The value that is appended to output to add a new line. This defaults to “n”, and should be String

entries.name: output
entries.desc: The output object. This defaults to '', and should accept the << method

entries.name: format(output=''.dup, maxwidth=79, newline="\n", genspace=lambda {|n| ' ' * n})
entries.desc: This is a convenience method which is same as follows:

entries.name: new(output=''.dup, maxwidth=79, newline="\n", &genspace)
entries.desc: Creates a buffer for pretty printing.

entries.name: singleline_format(output=''.dup, maxwidth=nil, newline=nil, genspace=nil)
entries.desc: This is similar to ::format but the result has no breaks.

entries.name: break_outmost_groups()
entries.desc: Breaks the buffer into lines that are shorter than maxwidth

entries.name: breakable(sep=' ', width=sep.length)
entries.desc: This says “you can break a line here if necessary”, and a width-column text sep is inserted if a line is not broken at the point.

entries.name: current_group()
entries.desc: Returns the group most recently added to the stack.

entries.name: fill_breakable(sep=' ', width=sep.length)
entries.desc: This is similar to breakable except the decision to break or not is determined individually.

entries.name: group(indent=0, open_obj='', close_obj='', open_width=open_obj.length, close_width=close_obj.length)
entries.desc: Groups line break hints added in the block. The line break hints are all to be used or not.

entries.name: group_sub()
entries.desc: Takes a block and queues a new group that is indented 1 level further.

entries.name: nest(indent)
entries.desc: Increases left margin after newline with indent for line breaks added in the block.

entries.name: text(obj, width=obj.length)
entries.desc: This adds obj as a text of width columns in width.
